201.description: Created: the account already exists. You are already registered, so you do not need to do anything else.

202.description: Created: the account does not exist. Depending on the method selected in the request, check your SMS or voice number for the registration code.

patch.description: If a field is not present in the request, no change is made to that setting. For example, if on_call_pager is not sent with the request, the existing configuration for on_call_pager is unchanged.

callback_backoff_delay_ms.description:
Backoff delay for a failed callback in milliseconds
This setting is used to configure the amount of time the backoff delays before retrying a failed callback. The backoff delay increases linearly by this value each time a callback fails to get a HTTPS 200 OK response. The backoff delay is capped by the max_callback_backoff_delay_ms setting.

callback_persist.description: Stores callbacks on disk until they are successfully acknowledged by the Webhook or not. Restart required.

heartbeat_interval.description: Multiconnect: Interval of the Master node monitoring of Coreapp nodes in seconds

max_callback_backoff_delay_ms.description: Maximum delay for a failed callback in milliseconds

on_call_pager.description: Set to valid WhatsApp Group with users who wish to see alerts for critical errors and messages.

pass_through.description:
When true, removes messages from the local database after they are delivered to or read by the recipient. When false, saves all messages on local storage until they are explicitly deleted.
When messages are sent, they are stored in a local database. This database is used as the application's history. Since the business keeps its own history, you can specify whether you want message pass_through or not. Restart required.

sent_status.description: Receive a notification that a message is sent to server. When true, you will receive a message indicating that a message has been sent. If false (default), you will not receive notification.

unhealthy_interval.description: Multiconnect: Maximum amount of seconds a Master node waits for a Coreapp node to respond to a heartbeat before considering it unhealthy and starting the failover process.

provider.name: <Provider Name from Media Provider API, optional

data.description: The data that has been backed up, encrypted for security.

password.description: Used to encrypt backup data for security

Backup-Settings-Response.description: Save the data value as that will be used along with your password to restore the information.
Backup-Settings-Response.title: Root Type for Backup-Settings-Response

address.description:
Address of the business
Maximum of 256 characters

description.description:
Description of the business
Maximum of 256 characters

email.description:
Email address to contact the business
Maximum of 128 characters

vertical.description:
Industry of the business
Maximum of 128 characters

websites.description:
URLs associated with business (e.g., website, Facebook page, Instagram)
Maximum of 2 websites with a maximum of 256 characters each

input.description: The value you sent in the contacts field of the JSON request.

x-enum-descriptions: processing: Input is still being processed.
valid: Input determined to be a valid WhatsApp user.
invalid: Input determined to not be a valid WhatsApp user or the phone number is in a bad format.

wa_id.description: WhatsApp user identifier that can be used in other API calls. Only returned if the status is valid.

blocking.description: Blocking determines whether the request should wait for the processing to complete (synchronous) or not (asynchronous).

contacts.description: Array of contact phone numbers. The numbers can be in any standard telephone number format.

day_of_week.description: Both strings and numbers are accepted. If different from the value derived from the date (if specified), use the derived value.

Date-Time-Object.description: The Whatsapp Business API Client will attempt to format the date/time based on a specified localization.
Date-Time-Object.title: Date-Time

Document.description: The media object containing a document
Document.title: Document

provider.name: <Provider Name from Media Provider API, optional

wa_ids.description: The WhatsApp IDs of the people to be added or removed as group admins

admins.description:
Group administrators
Lists IDs of the creator of the group and any administrators added

creator.description: ID of the creator of this group

participants.description:
Participants of the group
This is an array of all the IDs of the participants in the group. Initially, this will be the creator of the group.

Hsm.description: The containing element for the message content — Indicates that the message is highly structured. Parameters contained within provide the structure.

element_name.description: The element name that indicates which template to use within the namespace

localizable_params.description: This field is an array of values to apply to variables in the template

namespace.description: The namespace that will be used

Hsm.title: Hsm

Image.description: The media object containing an image
Image.title: Image

provider.name: <Provider Name from Media Provider API, optional

code.description: The code of the language or locale to use — Accepts both language and language_locale formats (e.g., en and en_US).

policy.description: The language policy the message should follow

address.description: Address of the location. Only displayed if name is present.

auto_download.description: An array specifying which types of media to automatically download.

Meta.description: Contains generic information such as WhatsApp Business API Client version.
Meta.title: Meta

formatted_name.description: Full name as it normally appears

type.description: Standard Values: CELL, MAIN, IPHONE, HOME, WORK

text.description:
Text to display in your profile's About section
The max length for the string is 139 characters.

example.name: <Provider Name from Media Provider API, optional

cc.description: Numerical country code for the phone number you are registering

method.description: Method of receiving your registration code

phone_number.description: Phone number you are registering, without the country code or plus symbol (+)

pin.description: Existing 6-digit PIN — This is only required when two-factor verification is enabled on this account.

errors.description: Only returned with a failed request. Contains an array of error objects that are present when there is an error.

data.description: The data that was returned by the /v1/settings/backup API call

password.description: The password you used in the /v1/settings/backup API call to encrypt the backup data

preview_url.description:
Specifying preview_url in the request is optional when not including a URL in your message.
To include a URL preview, set preview_url to true in the message body and make sure the URL begins with http:// or https://. For more information, see the Sending URLs in Text Messages section.

recipient_type.description:
Determines whether the recipient is an individual or a group
Specifying recipient_type in the request is optional when the value is individual.
However, recipient_type is required when using group. If sending a text message to a group, see the Sending Group Messages documentation.

to.description: When recipient_type is individual, this field is the WhatsApp ID (phone number) returned from contacts endpoint. When recipient_type is group, this field is the WhatsApp group ID.

expires_after.description: Token expiration timestamp. By default, this is 7 days.

token.description:
Authentication token to be used for all other WhatsApp Business API calls. The token must be sent in the authorization header in the format:
Authorization: Bearer <authentication-token>

Video.description: The media object containing a video
Video.title: Video

provider.name: <Provider Name from Media Provider API, optional

file.description: Absolute filename and location on media volume. This parameter is deprecated.

filename.description: Filename on the sender's device. This will only be present in audio and document media messages.

id.description: ID of the media. Can be used to delete the media if stored locally on the client.

wa_id.description: The WhatsApp ID of the contact

name.description: Optional. As of v2.21.4, contains the sender's profile name.

file.description: Absolute filename and location on media volume. This parameter is deprecated.

filename.description: Filename on the sender's device. This will only be present in audio and document media messages.

id.description: ID of the media. Can be used to delete the media if stored locally on the client.

file.description: Absolute filename and location on media volume. This parameter is deprecated.

id.description: ID of the media. Can be used to delete the media if stored locally on the client.

example.address: Main Street Beach, Santa Cruz, CA
example.name: Main Street Beach

url.description: URL for the website where the user downloaded the location information

errors.title: Failed to send message because you are outside the support window for freeform messages to this user. Please use a valid HSM notification or reconsider.

x-enum-descriptions: Message received by WhatsApp server (One checkmark in WhatsApp Mobile)
Message delivered to recipient (Two checkmarks in WhatsApp Mobile)
Message read by recipient (Two blue checkmarks in WhatsApp Mobile)
Message failed to send (Red error triangle in WhatsApp Mobile)
Error adding users to the group
Error adding a user to the group
Group is at capacity and no more users can be added
Error attempting to add a user that blocked the adder

file.description: Absolute filename and location on media volume. This parameter is deprecated.

id.description: ID of the media. Can be used to delete the media if stored locally on the client.

file.description: Absolute filename and location on media volume. This parameter is deprecated.

id.description: ID of the media. Can be used to delete the media if stored locally on the client.

max_concurrent_requests.description: Configures the maximum number of inflight callback requests that are sent out. Can be set to 6 (default), 12, 18, or 24.

url.description: Inbound and outbound notifications are routed to this URL. A HTTPS-based endpoint is required; HTTP will not work.
